We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Visa Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Agege, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Visa Officer is responsible for managing all visa-related processes for clients, including application submissions, documentation review, and communication with embassies or immigration authorities.
	The role requires attention to detail, strong customer service skills, and an ability to handle sensitive information professionally.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist clients with visa applications, ensuring all required documents are complete and accurate.
	Review and verify client documents before submission to embassies or consulates.
	Provide up-to-date information on visa requirements, processing times, and fees.
	Communicate with embassies, immigration offices, and travel partners to track application progress.
	Handle client inquiries and provide professional support throughout the visa process.
	Maintain proper records of all visa applications and correspondence.
	Report application outcomes and provide feedback to management.
	Stay informed about changes in immigration and visa policies.
	Ensure confidentiality and compliance with all regulatory requirements.


Requirements


	SSCE / OND / HND is required must have finished from a reputable aviation school.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in visa processing, travel consultancy, or a related role.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and digital documentation systems.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience liaising with embassies or immigration bodies.
	Knowledge of visa requirements for multiple destinations.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


Salary
N80,000 per month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resumes to:&nbsp;hr@eldersgroup.com.ng&nbsp;using Job Position as the subject of the email.",

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Visa Officer
Job Location: Agege, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Visa Officer is responsible for managing all visa-related processes for clients, including application submissions, documentation review, and communication with embassies or immigration authorities.
	The role requires attention to detail, strong customer service skills, and an ability to handle sensitive information professionally.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist clients with visa applications, ensuring all required documents are complete and accurate.
	Review and verify client documents before submission to embassies or consulates.
	Provide up-to-date information on visa requirements, processing times, and fees.
	Communicate with embassies, immigration offices, and travel partners to track application progress.
	Handle client inquiries and provide professional support throughout the visa process.
	Maintain proper records of all visa applications and correspondence.
	Report application outcomes and provide feedback to management.
	Stay informed about changes in immigration and visa policies.
	Ensure confidentiality and compliance with all regulatory requirements.


Requirements


	SSCE / OND / HND is required must have finished from a reputable aviation school.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in visa processing, travel consultancy, or a related role.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and digital documentation systems.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience liaising with embassies or immigration bodies.
	Knowledge of visa requirements for multiple destinations.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.

Method of Application

Accounts Officer Job at Caring Habitat




        
    

        
        Caring Habitat is a 40-room purpose-built inpatient skilled nursing and rehabilitation hospital designed to complement the health outcomes of patients through the delivery robust rehabilitation program.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer

Job Location: Abraham Adesanya - Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Account officer/book keeper has overall responsibility for managing all patients’ account with regards to billing information and communication to patients, ensuring payment and payment reconciliation, keeping the company ledger for all income and expenditure and preparing accounting report for management.


Responsibilities


	Responsible for all patient’s billing.
	Daily billing and reconciliation of patient’s account using appropriate application including the Electronic Medical Records (EMR).
	Preparing bill summary for patients/relative/sponsor with clear explanation on the rationale for billing. Responsible for presenting and discussing the bills with the patient/relatives/sponsor.
	Following up with patient/relatives/sponsor on timely payment (admission deposit and periodic top ups) so that the patient’s account is not in deficit.
	Updating/Managing bills on the EMR such that the billable services are correctly billed at any point in time.
	Working with other stakeholders to correctly capture all billable services for patients to avoid billing errors.
	Will keep company ledger vis-à-vis a statement of revenue/income and expenditure, categorizing the various income received etc.
	Prepares monthly summary/breakdown/report of the revenues and expenditure per category for management report.
	Monthly account reconciliation.
	Track and document company loans.
	Payroll tracking and payments.
	Oversight on departmental expenditure vetting for submission to General Manager.
	Any other assigned related tasks.


Requirements


	BSC / HND in Accounting or any other related discipline.
	At least 5 years of Experience in the Accounting Field.
	Strong Knowledge of Quickbooks.
	Reporting and analytical skill.
	Sound knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications especially Microsoft Excel.
	Very good negotiation skills.
	Very good data management.


Benefits


	N350,000 Monthly Net
	Leave Allowance
	HMO
	Pension.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Applications to: caringhabitatgl@gmail.com using "Accounts Officer" as the subject of the mail.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Facility Manager",
  "description": "ShogxyPro Outsourcing is a forward-thinking HR and talent solutions firm based in Lagos, Nigeria. We specialize in recruitment, staff outsourcing, compliance management, and workforce development for businesses across various industries.

Our goal is simple: help organizations grow by connecting them with the right people and building compliant, efficient HR systems. We serve startups, SMEs, and large enterprises looking to scale without the burden of in-house HR challenges.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Facility Manager will be responsible for overseeing, maintaining, and improving the company&rsquo;s buildings, infrastructure, and grounds to ensure they are safe, functional, efficient, and compliant with regulatory standards.

Grade: SM – AGM

Job Summary


	Ensure that the Bank’s target on creation/maintenance of public sector business are met through effective relationship management; and deliver effective marketing strategies to ensure the growth and profitability within area of responsibility.

	Work with the team to develop detailed project plans.
	Assist in determining and defining project scope and objectives.
	Predict resources needed to reach objectives and manage resources In an effective and efficient manner

	Work with the team in monitoring progress and make adjustments as needed

  "title": "QA / QC / HSE Officer",
  "description": "Dexterous Applied Training Institute (DATI) is a leading consultancy, training, and development institute, certified across multiple industries in which we operate. We are dedicated to supporting Public and Private Organizations, Oil &amp; Gas companies and their host communities, Manufacturing and Production firms, Energy providers, Hospitality businesses, and Educational institutions.

Our mission is to bridge skills gaps, provide expert guidance on emerging upskilling needs, and develop human resource capacity in line with global best practices and standards. By aligning workforce development with organizational goals and facilitating technology transfer, we help institutions achieve sustainable growth and long-term competitiveness.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QA / QC / HSE Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The QA/QC/HSE Officer will be responsible for safeguarding the quality, compliance, and safety of training outputs within the Planning, Research, and Development (PRD) Department.
	The role involves enforcing QA/QC processes, ensuring accreditation maintenance, and embedding HSE standards in training delivery and facilities management.
	The job holder will also contribute as an instructor in QA/QC and HSE-related courses


Key Responsibilities


	Implement and monitor QA/QC processes for course materials and assessments as well as organizational processes.
